# Initialize empty dataframe
    df = pd.DataFrame(columns=['Car', 'Color'])

    # Add rows to dataframe based on dictionary
    df.loc[:,'Car'] = [x for x in car_dict.keys()]
    df.loc[:,'Color'] = [car_dict.get(x) for x in car_dict.keys()]
    print(df)
    # Visualize dataframe using bar chart
    ax = df.plot.bar(title='Distribution of Vehicle Colors', grid=True, rot=0)
    plt.show()
    # Return dataframe and plot object
    return df, ax

# create a dictionary with car brand and color as keys
    car_dict = {'Ford': 'Red', 'Toyota': 'Blue', 'Mercedes': 'Black', 'Tesla': 'White', 'BMW': 'Silver'}

    # create a dataframe from the dictionary
    df = pd.DataFrame(car_dict, index=[0])
    # create a bar chart with the dataframe
    plt.bar(df['Car'], df['Color'])
    # set the title of the chart
    plt.title('Distribution of Vehicle Colors')

    # return the dataframe and the axes
    return df, plt.gca()

df = pd.DataFrame(list(car_dict.items()), columns=['Car', 'Color'])
    df.set_index('Car', inplace=True)
    df.sort_index(inplace=True)
    ax = df.plot.bar()
    ax.set_title("Distribution of Vehicle Colors", fontsize=15)
    return df, ax

df = pd.DataFrame(car_dict, index=[0])

    df.set_index('Car', drop=False, inplace=True)
    return df, plt.bar(df['Car'], df['Color'])

df = pd.DataFrame(car_dict, index=[0])

# Task 1. Create a DataFrame from the dictionary and visualize the data
    df = pd.DataFrame.from_dict(car_dict, orient='index').reset_index(drop=True)
    df.columns = ['Car', 'Color']

    # Task 2. Visualize the data with a bar chart
    plt.style.use('fivethirtyeight')
    plt.title('Distribution of Vehicle Colors')
    plt.xticks(rotation=90)
    plt.bar(df['Car'], df['Color'], color=df['Color'].values, width=0.8)
    plt.show()

    return df, plt.gca()

df = pd.DataFrame(data=car_dict)
    df.columns = ['Car', 'Color']
    fig, ax = plt.subplots()
    df.plot(kind='bar', ax=ax, color=df['Color'])
    return df, ax

    df = pd.DataFrame.from_dict(car_dict, orient = 'index')
    df.reset_index(inplace = True)
    df.columns = ['Car', 'Color']

    plt.barh(df['Car'], df['Color'], align='center', height=0.4, color='#FFFFFF')
    plt.title('Distribution of Vehicle Colors')
    plt.show()
    return df, plt.gca()
